---
title: "Initialize RollApp"
slug: initialize
---

### Initialization

Initializing the configuration files of the RollApp will create the necessary information to start a new RollApp. This will create a folder `~/.roller` in the root directory of your computer with important files such as the `Genesis` file.

Developers have two options for initializing the configuration files, an interactive guide or by using CLI flags:

`````mdx-code-block
import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

````mdx-code-block

<Tabs groupId="guide">
<TabItem value="Interactive guide" label="Interactive guide">

```
roller config init --interactive
```

<details>
<summary>Interactive guide breakdown</summary>

<div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Select your network</summary>
    <div>
        <div><b>- Devnet (default)</b>: Non-incentivized public Devnet for building and testing. Uses live testnets for DA and bridging.</div>
        <div><b>- Local</b>: Includes the option for a Mock DA network (no faucet tokens needed). Requires running a localhost Dymension Hub node please visit <a href="/validate/dymension-hub/build-dymd">here </a>
        to run a Devnet Dymension Hub full node first.</div>
        <div><b>- Froopyland</b>: Very Soon</div>
    </div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Enter your RollApp ID</summary>
        <div><b>- Name</b>: Lowercase English letters</div>
        <div><b>- EIP155</b>: 1 to 5 digit number representing the EIP155 rollapp ID</div>
        <div><b>- Version</b>: 1 to 5 digit number representing the version</div>
        <br />
        <div><b>Example</b>: berlin_9191-2</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Specify your RollApp denom</summary>
        <div>Name of the native token of the RollApp in English letters.</div>
        <br />
        <div>e.g BTC, PEPE, DYM</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Set the genesis token supply</summary>
        <div>This is the initial token supply in the RollApp (default: 1,000,000,000)</div>
        <br />
        <div>Note: Tokens amounts are multiplied by 10^18 (18 additional decimal places). As such when specifying CLI transactions be attentive to the amount of decimals each transaction should have.</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Choose your data layer</summary>
        <div><b>- Celestia</b>: Arabica testnet</div>
        <div><b>- Avail</b>: Kate testnet</div>
        <div><b>- Mock</b>: Simulates publishing to a DA network, useful for local development (only available in `Local` mode)</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Select your execution environment</summary>
        <div><b>- EVM (default)</b>: Stores runtime binary in default PATH (e.g. /usr/local/bin/rollapp_evm)</div>
        <div><b>- RDK</b>: Requires specifying runtime binary path (e.g. /usr/local/bin/rollapp)</div>
    </details>
</div>


</div>
</details>


</TabItem>
<TabItem value="Flags" label="Flags">

```
roller config init <rollapp-id> <denom>
```

<details>
<summary>Flags breakdown</summary>

<div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>rollapp-id</summary>
    <div><b>- Name</b>: Lowercase English letters</div>
    <div><b>- EIP155</b>: 1 to 5 digit number representing the EIP155 rollapp ID</div>
    <div><b>- Version</b>: 1 to 5 digit number representing the version</div>
    <br />
    <div><b>Example</b>: berlin_9191-2</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>denom</summary>
        <div>Name of the native token of the RollApp in English letters.</div>
        <br />
        <div>e.g BTC, PEPE, DYM</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>hub (optional)</summary>
        <div><b>- Devnet (default)</b>: Non-incentivized public Devnet for building and testing</div>
        <div><b>- Local</b>: Uses localhost Dymension Hub node and mock DA network</div>
        <div><b>- Froopyland</b>: Very Soon</div>
        <div><b>- Mainnet</b>: Soon</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>token-supply (optional)</summary>
        <div>This is the initial token supply in the RollApp (default: 1,000,000,000)</div>
        <br />
        <div>Note: Tokens amounts are multiplied by 10^18 (18 additional decimal places). As such when specifying CLI transactions be attentive to the amount of decimals each transaction should have.</div>
    </details>
</div>

</div>
</details>

</TabItem>

</Tabs>

### Address funding

<Tabs>
<TabItem value="Devnet funding" label="Devnet funding">

After initializing the RollApp, addresses to fund should be returned to you:

```
ðŸ”‘ Addresses:

Sequencer <network> | Address used to publish state updates to the Dymension Hub
Relayer   <network> | Address that handles the relaying of IBC packets
DA        <network> | Address used to publish data on-chain to the DA network
```

In Dymension's [discord](https://discord.gg/dymension) please fund the addresses in the `faucet` channel with the following command as an example:

```
$request dym15ad5y52e3zx784hl0b4uyw5huctktwty2dq2vn
$request dym1j968h4avztqmgeh3bn4p2tfh4ptxp055e056sy
```

You can then check the balance of the address with:

```
$balance dym15ad5y52e3zx784hl0b4uyw5huctktwty2dq2vn
```

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="Local funding" label="Local funding">

After initializing the RollApp, addresses to fund should be returned to you:

```
ðŸ”‘ Addresses:

Sequencer | Address used to publish state updates to the Dymension Hub
Relayer   | Address that handles the relaying of IBC packets
```

While the Dymension Hub full node is running, publish the following transaction via CLI:

```
dymd tx bank send local-user <ADDRESS-TO-FUND> 1udym --yes -b block --keyring-backend test
```

You can then check the balance of the address with:

```
dymd q bank balances <ADDRESS>
```

</TabItem>
</Tabs>
`````

Now that we've funded the wallets we can go ahead and register the RollApp!
